at.ac.oeaw.cemm.bsf.vcffilter.genomeutils

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.oeaw.cemm.bsf.vcffilter.genomeutils.Query
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Permits fast searching of overlaps between GenomicElements. Query.java 04 OCT 2016
    Since:
    1.0

        Takes a list of regions and generates a non-overlapping list of regions covered by any of the input regions.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        ArrayList<GenomicElement<
        Since:
        1.0

      • complement

        public java.util.ArrayList<GenomicElement> complement(java.util.ArrayList<GenomicElement> regions)
        Takes a list of regions and generates a non-overlapping list of regions covered by any of the input regions. Then complements the list. Currently not working correctly as contigs with 0 input regions are missing in output. Proper implementation should read the contigs from the source VCF file. Useful for black list filtering.
        Parameters:
        regions - list of genomic regions
        Returns:
        ArrayList<GenomicElement<
        Since:
        1.0

      • initAnnotations

        public void initAnnotations(java.util.ArrayList<GenomicElement> in)
        private method that inits the Regions and Indices Hashtables. The region elements for each chromosome are added as GenomicElement objects to separate Vector objects that can be retrieved by chromosome name. The index of the last overlapping region element is stored in the Indices Hashtable.
        Parameters:
        in - the annotations as GenomicElement containing ArrayList

      • initPointAnnotations

        public void initPointAnnotations(java.util.ArrayList<GenomicElement> in,
                                 java.lang.String point)
        private method that inits the Regions and Indices Hashtables. The region elements for each chromosome are added as GenomicElement objects to separate Vector objects that can be retrieved by chromosome name. The index of the last overlapping region element is stored in the Indices Hashtable.
        Parameters:
        in - the annotations as GenomicElement containing ArrayList
        point - start point

      • rangeQuery

        public java.util.Vector<GenomicElement> rangeQuery(GenomicElement query)
        Returns the GenomicElements that overlap with the query interval stacked in a Vector object
        Parameters:
        query - defines the range being interrogated
        Returns:
        Vector holding all GenomicElements overlapping with query range, Vector size() == 0 if no overlap exists
